metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12584 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The ConnectionBase::preparseNewBytes function in resip/stack/ConnectionBase.cxx in reSIProcate through 1.10.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow) or possibly execute arbitrary code when TLS communication is enabled. It was discovered that reSIProcate incorrectly handled SIP message bodies. A remote attacker could exploit this with a crafted SIP message to cause reSIProcate to crash, resulting in a denial of service (buffer overflow).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

librecon-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
libresiprocate-turn-client-1.9 - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
repro - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
resiprocate-turn-server - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
sipdialer - 1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: resiprocate package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.7-4~ubuntu14.04.1+esm1').
